column5: Have been pretty busy lately.Fishing at few lodges on Cedar and bouncing around between Cedar Point Resort,Cedar Lake camp.Cedar Lake Lodge and Northern Lights.Water temps 63f on main lake and bay's warmer.Mayfly hatch is happening and walleye bite very aggressive now.been having 80-100 Fish days with lot of diff guests.New guests and returning guests.Live seens to be getting normal.Yesterday got out on Lac Suel from Lac Suel Lodge and met back up with great guys ice been fishing with for years and we had a great time tgere also.Fishing was pretty awesome on the big pond.https://www.facebook.com/groups/8209...7381518460973/
I will be on the big pond in a couple of weeks John. What depths? I suspect you were jig fishing? Any fish yet on the main lake humps buddy? Thx!

Nothing rifht now to get excited over but a few are creeping out there.Next week a bunch will get there.Fishing shorelines with some structure 13 ft last couple of days.today water temp 69 f on main lake.things will start happening may flies out today.
So the may flies are a good thing? Been going North for many years but not mid Summer like we are this year. Lake St Joe and Root Bay starting next Thu
There a good thing for the fish,all you can eat buffet.

My (Our) experiences regarding the mayfly hatch is that IF you are fishing when the hatch starts - you can use almost anything and the walleyes will hit it - after a few days of the hatch, the walleyes seem to get a little fussier - I'm sure it is because they are getting full stomachs.......

That makes sense TVFish. I waa thinking if they fill up on mayflies would kill the fishing at some point. Hopefully we hit it next week when they are just starting to hatch so it is the fish feeding frenzy previously described!!!

Pike find whitefish and walleyes that are feeding on mayflies. Pike load up on whitefish & walleyes, eating so much that they end up hugging the bottom, belching and off their feed for a few days. You might catch a couple with blood suckers attched to their bellies.
